intro: Trachymene billardierei var. cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, blue or purple flowers that appear in clusters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a distinct, fern-like appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or swampy areas.
